alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 6:22AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Georgetown County through 700 AM EDT... At 620 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Georgetown, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, very heavy rain, and cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Murrells Inlet, Litchfield Beach, Georgetown Memorial Hospital and Waccamaw Community Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
